title: Help a scrub out
body:
I just installed the game maybe a week ago, the last time I played was around launch, and I didn't really like it so I stopped, but I'm loving the game now.

I've just got some noob questions about some champs that I've been struggling with, and judging by the forums, it's common for nubs and scrubs to struggle against these, though I can't find any concrete, helpful advice.

I've taken a liking to Top lane, and I like playing {{champion:150}}, {{champion:114}} and {{champion:164}}. I'd say I'm decent all things considered at all 3, but when I have to lane against a {{champion:86}} or {{champion:13}} (though with Ryze it's more me getting frustrated by his snares), and even worse is when a {{champion:11}} or {{champion:157}} help them out on top, I die pretty much every single time. I just don't know WTF I'm supposed to do half the time against a Garen, since he seems to be able to spam out his abilities every 3 seconds and do ridiculous amounts of damage, even in early game, and I can't even escape from the guy.

Though I haven't encountered much of him, {{champion:122}} also gave me a LOT of trouble when I laned against him some games ago. I was always just left amazed at how much freakin' damage he did to me in just one ability.

So yeah, any help or tips would be greatly appreciated!

replies.body:
{{champion:122}} {{champion:86}} are more or less broken and unbeatable (but not really OP, for reasons i will get to). You will never win lane against them unless you are playing a mobile ranged champion, another juggernaut with broken sustain, or get ganks constantly.

Top has a lot of binary won-in-champ-select matchups. What you need to do is just not fight them. Stay back, farm and defend until the team phase starts.

> [{quoted}](name=MagicFlyingLlama,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=z7xxtWpE,comment-id=0000,timestamp=2017-12-22T03:44:48.759+0000)
>
> {{champion:122}} {{champion:86}} are more or less broken and unbeatable (but not really OP, for reasons i will get to). You will never win lane against them unless you are playing a mobile ranged champion, another juggernaut with broken sustain, or get ganks constantly.
> 
> Top has a lot of binary won-in-champ-select matchups. What you need to do is just not fight them. Stay back, farm and defend until the team phase starts.

This is slightly embellished, but kinda true.

Garen and Darius are pretty bad out of lane.  Darius doesn't have the means to reach people unless he's popping flash E.  Darius can at least get resets in teamfights but that's hardly common.  Garen's a total lane bully.  Outside of lane he gets kited extremely hard.

The top 3 champions you picked - Gnar is a teamfighting monster.  Fiora can split push and 1 v 1 almost any champion late game.  Camille doesn't have the issues the other two have, she has massive engage range and can still target people and the ult is a great teamfighting tool for isolating targets.

You're not trying to win lane if you're laning against Garen/Darius, that's not what you want to do.  It's not the strength of the champs you picked.
You have to look at the matchup and say 'I'm a teamfighter laning against a lane bully."  This allows you to prioritize.  Farm up, play it safe, wait for jungle help, and wait until the time comes for you to utilize the strengths of the champions you picked.

Although with that said you should be able to kite them out pretty hard with Gnar.
